page.title: 05Religion in Uzmaston area
page.content: There are two churches, St.Issell's, Haroldston and St.Ismael's, Uzmaston and a Presbyterian Chapel at Millin. Services are held once a month at Haroldston when the Holy Eucharist is celebrated and once a week at Millin when Morning Service is held. St.Ismael's is the best attended church where services are held weekly, the most popular being the Family Eucharist (2nd & 4th Sunday of the month at 0930). Attendances vary from thirty at Evensong, Sundays at 1830, to over fifty at Family Eucharist. Holy Eucharist is celebrated at 1115 or 0900 on the 1st,3rd & 5th Sundays. The Vicar is also Vicar of St.John's, Slebech. There is a thriving Sunday School and Choir and the Church Hall is used for various other activities, refreshments after service, Mother & Toddler Group, Womens Institute etc.
